content.question:
Figure 1. Estimate of rates of speciation and rates of species extinction in temperate and tropical biomes over the last <math alttext="175" overflow="scroll"><mn>175</mn></math> million years

Assuming both temperate and tropical biomes had equivalent biodiversity <math alttext="175" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million years ago, which of the following claims is best supported by the data in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: Tropical biomes in the present have less biodiversity than do temperate biomes.
Tropical biomes in the present have greater biodiversity than do temperate biomes.
The rate of extinction is lower in temperate biomes than in tropical biomes.
The rate of speciation in both temperate and tropical biomes has not changed over time.

content.answer: Tropical biomes in the present have greater biodiversity than do temperate biomes.
